summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York inquiring about the availability of crisis counseling for victims of Jeffrey Epstein following his death by suicide. The email expresses concern that victims may struggle with their accusations remaining unvindicated.

events.title: Inquiry about victim counseling after Epstein suicide
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails to ask about availability of crisis counseling for Epstein's victims following his death, noting victims may struggle with accusations remaining unvindicated.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 10, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
It reveals that victims' counsel had questions about crisis counseling availability for Epstein's victims following his suicide.
The prosecutor expresses concern that victims may struggle with the idea their accusations could remain unvindicated due to Epstein's death.
The correspondence indicates official consideration for victim support services in the aftermath of the case.
